model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I'm pretty excited! They just added one of my favorite dishes to the menu at work. I can't wait for my next shift so I can try it for free. I will send you a pic later, ok? 
Speaker B: Okay, yes, please send me a pic as soon as you can. I can't wait to see it. What is the name of the dish?
Speaker A: It's a Chicken parmesan, with a red pepper marinara. It's so crisp and juicy-I love it! They serve it with these sweet roasted asparagus!
Speaker B: Oh that sounds absolutely fabulous. Are you going to get a free dessert, as well?
Speaker A: Yes, I am thinking about trying either the new eclairs, or their tres leches cake with fresh raspberry jam sauce and lemon drizzle! I have too many good options to pick from! What one would you pick?
Speaker B: Hands down, I would pick the tres leches. Ever since I tried it a few years ago, it has always been my favorite dessert.
Speaker A: Okay, I will try that! I've heard the can be made with different fruits. Did you have fruit with yours?
Speaker B: I like it best with fresh strawberries. And then it is even better with some fresh whipped cream and chocolate drizzle. Just thinking about it is making me want to have some right now!
Speaker A: Ooh, that sounds delicious! It's a rich and moist cake, so I don't think it should have too much chocolate. I've seen brown sugar and caramel versions too!
Speaker B: Oh I've never seen that version. That sounds scrumptuous. Tonight I'm going to bake some oatmeal raisin cookies.

MEMORY:
Speaker A enjoys the interaction with people at work and the variety of experiences that come with it. Speaker A works at a restaurant and gets two free meals per week, along with taking home leftover baked goods.
Speaker A owns a restaurant and recently experienced a fire incident but managed to put it out. Speaker A had to put out a fire at work, which was unexpected but seems to have been handled without issues.

speaker: Speaker A
raw_prediction: Oatmeal raisin cookies sound perfect for tonight, especially after all this talk about dessert!
prediction:
Brief explanation: The given MEMORY contains information about Speaker A's occupation and experiences at work, including their enjoyment in interacting with people and getting two free meals per week. It also mentions an incident where Speaker A had to put out a fire. However, this information does not directly pertain to Speaker A's excitement about trying a new dish on the menu or the desserts they are considering during the current conversation. The MEMORY does not provide specific details relevant to the ongoing discussion about food preferences or recommendations.
Judgement: "No"
